issue.title: Surface SIDH as a KEM in master branch
issue.body: SIKE is already exposed as a KEM, but SIDH is not exposed as a KEM (even though the code is probably already there).  Once this is done, we can remove kex\_sidh\_msr.

issue.title: Shared library support added
issue.body:
Once the following errors are resolved shared library will be built fine.

Locally the build can be tested with shared library by:

./configure  --disable-kex-sidh-msr; make clean; make -j8; make test 

Static library can be tested by:

./configure  LDFLAGS="-static" --disable-kex-sidh-msr; make clean; make -j8; make test

comment.body: #368 has landed so this should be able to resolved, @smashra

issue.title: Removed the OQS_RAND object from the sig API
issue.body: Removed the OQS_RAND object from the sig API to harmonize with the KEM API (c.f., issue #374)

comment.body: While we're at it, should we also change the algorithm identifier passed to `OQS_SIG_new` to be a string, just like in nist-branch?

issue.title: Add shared library build to testing system
issue.body: On nist-branch we build `test_kem` (which statically links against liboqs.a) and `test_kem_shared` (which dynamically links against liboqs.so) and test both of them in Travis.  Is there a way to do that on master branch?

comment.body:
Mac builds are failing because of utilities.c contain no symbols.
The only way I could come up to fix it is disable static library build on Mac.
But I'm not sure if we want to disable static build of liboqs on Mac.
May be Nir can look into this.

issue.title: Removed the OQS_RAND object from the sig API
issue.body: Removed the OQS_RAND object from the sig API to harmonize with the KEM API (c.f., issue #374)

comment.body: Yes; it would be good to have uniformity. I quickly push that out to enable moving the OpenSSL fork to the KEM API (where the rand object is not needed anymore). I got that working locally, so we can either do the refactoring in two parts (this PR and a following one), or do all the work on this PR and wait to push the OpenSSL update (the latter has fewer PRs, so perhaps cleaner)

issue.title: Remove kex_ntru (issue #370).
issue.body:
1st shot at removing kex_ntru.
https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/issues/370

References to ntru exist in the visual studio project files. I don't have windows at all, so didn't touch that part.

comment.body: This also needs a new example algorithm in the docs for kex_bench_memory.sh

issue.title: Move OpenSSH to new KEM API
issue.body:
Change our fork of OpenSSH so it uses our new KEM API.  

- Since the only KEMs currently on liboqs master branch are BIKE, FrodoKEM, and SIKE, this patch also removes NewHope and NTRU-based KEX methods in OpenSSH.
- This can be built against either liboqs nist-branch of liboqs master branch.
- It adds a "oqsdefault" KEX method that maps onto whatever the default KEM is in liboqs; see the updated README.md for an explanation of this functionality.

Torben, I created a new AL2 instance and installed everything from scratch using master branch of liboqs and OQS-master branch of openssh-portable. Got the same error.

Here is the output of 'ssh -G -F ssh_config localhost:
